Pre-Game Insights: The Hornets (7-26) are looking to snap a nine-game losing streak and own the second worst overall record in the Eastern Conference.
On Friday, Charlotte was limited to 29 points during the second half of a 98-84 road loss against Detroit.

Charlotte F Miles Bridges tallied a team-high 20 points (5-16 FG), nine rebounds, and five assists. Mark Williams added 18 points (7-12 FG) and nine boards for the Hornets, who missed 21 of 30 three-point attempts.
The Cavaliers (30-4) have reeled off nine straight victories and own the best overall record in the NBA.
On Friday, Cleveland raced out to an 11-point lead after one quarter and shot 53 percent from the field during a 134-122 road victory against Dallas.

Cleveland F Evan Mobley poured in a game-high 34 points on 14-for-21 shooting and grabbed ten rebounds. Caris LeVert scored 17 points (7-15 FG) in 25 minutes off the bench. Darius Garland added 16 points and nine assists for the Cavaliers.
Cleveland F Isaac Okoro has been sidelined for the last two weeks with a sprained AC joint in his right shoulder.
